additionalTextInformation.text:
Several variants of this composition are known today and variously attributed to Lucas Cranach the Elder, his workshop or his son. Examples range from [DE_SAOH_1997-3b] and [PRIVATE_NONE-P039] to slightly larger formats like [PRIVATE_NONE-P412] or a further almost identical, but slightly larger version of the present painting. [PRIVATE_NONE-P483]

[cda 2021]

pageContext.description:
The Virgin is shown seated at the centre of the image on a wooden beam framing the edge of a grass verge. She holds the infant Christ on her lap, who takes a berry offered to him by a cherub. A further three cherubs are busy collecting berries in the foreground, a forth stands at the Virgin's left, and together with another two cherubs he holds a dark curtain that serves as a backdrop for the figurative group. A mountainous landscape with both a fortress and a town is visible in the far distance.
[cda 2021]
